description: Lists all contact channels for the specified contact.

parameters.name: ContactId
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: The pagination token to continue to the next page of results.

nested_items.name: ContactChannels
nested_items.description: A list of contact channels related to the specified contact.

nested_items.name: ContactChannelArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the contact channel.

nested_items.name: ContactArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the contact that contains the contact channel.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the contact channel.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The type of the contact channel. Incident Manager supports three contact methods:

nested_items.name: DeliveryAddress
nested_items.description: The details that Incident Manager uses when trying to engage the contact channel.

nested_items.name: SimpleAddress
nested_items.description: The format is dependent on the type of the contact channel. The following are the expected formats:
SMS - --+' followed by the country code and phone number.
VOICE - --+' followed by the country code and phone number.

nested_items.name: ActivationStatus
nested_items.description: A Boolean value describing if the contact channel has been activated or not. If the contact channel isn't activated, Incident Manager can't engage the contact through it.
